lines.content: > ‚ÄúYour mind is for having ideas, not holding them.‚Äù ‚Äì David Allen
Hannah has a ton of features for you to try!!
All you need to do is:
4. Let it manage your tasks for you! üòâ
If you are a Java programmer, you can use it to practice Java too. Here's the main method:
You can also edit your code using `inline code` like this: `TaskList.addTask()`.

Hannah Bot is a simple task management application that allows you to keep track of tasks including todos, deadlines, and events. It features a graphical user interface (GUI) for interacting with the bot, and it can handle various commands to manage and organize your tasks efficiently.
You can add a todo task to the list by using the `todo` command.
The bot will confirm the addition of the new todo task to your list.
You now have 1 task in your list.
Add a task with a specific deadline using the `deadline` command.
The bot will add the deadline to your list and display the task.
You now have 2 tasks in your list.
Add events with specific start and end times using the `event` command.
The bot will add the event to your list and display the task.
You now have 3 tasks in your list.
View all tasks in the list using the `list` command.
The bot will display all tasks currently in the list.
Mark a task as done using the `mark` command.
The bot will mark the specified task as done.
Unmark a task as not done using the `unmark` command.
The bot will unmark the specified task.
Delete a task from the list using the `delete` command.
The bot will delete the specified task from the list.
You now have 2 tasks in your list.
Search for tasks containing a keyword using the `find` command.
The bot will display all tasks that match the keyword.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Exit the bot using the `bye` command.
The bot will display a goodbye message and exit.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
- Use clear and descriptive task descriptions to make it easier to manage your tasks.
- Check the format and date formats (`yyyy-MM-dd`) when adding deadlines or events.
- Use the `list` command frequently to keep track of your tasks.
Hannah Bot provides an intuitive and efficient way to manage your tasks, helping you stay organized and on top of your to-dos. Enjoy using Hannah Bot!

* Represents the main class for the Hannah application.
* The Hannah class manages tasks by interacting with the user through commands
* such as adding, deleting, marking tasks, and finding tasks. It stores and retrieves
* tasks using the Storage class, and processes user input using the Parser class.
* The Hannah class represents the main application for managing tasks.
* It interacts with the user through the command line and processes tasks
* such as ToDos, Deadlines, and Events.
* Runs the Hannah application, handling user input and managing tasks.
* The application continues running until the user types "bye".

result = "Please add a task after event";

* Returns a string containing the help message with all the available commands.
* The help message includes details on how to use the following commands:
* - todo: Adds a new todo task.
* - deadline: Adds a new deadline task with a specified date.
* - event: Adds a new event task with a specified date.
* - mark/unmark: Marks or unmarks a task as done.
* - delete: Deletes a task based on its task number.
* @return A string that contains the help message with command descriptions.
helpMessage.append("deadline [task] /by [date] - Adds a new deadline task\n");
helpMessage.append("event [task] /at [date] - Adds a new event task\n");
helpMessage.append("mark/unmark [task number] - Marks/unmarks a task as done\n");

* This constructor is used when the command requires additional arguments.
* @param arguments The arguments for the command (e.g., task details, task number).

* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task.
* @return A string in the format "[D][status] taskName by deadlineDate".

* The date string must be in the "yyyy-MM-dd" format.

assertEquals(task2, taskList.getTask(2), "Second task should match task2");
